Chandlers own "formal-ish" italian.  We love this place.  The menu is good and the vibe says Italian.  Great place to bring the family or a big party for a night of Vino and Italian eats.  Make a reservation

I took my girlfriend to La Stalla for her birthday dinner last night, and we had an excellent experience. 

The tasty complimentary bread was properly warm, good and crusty on the outside but soft inside. Olive oil's on the table, and you pour it yourself. I confess I prefer to have the server pour the oil, but maybe I am spoiled. 

I ordered a 2006 Sangiovese (#411 on the wine list) that our server bought out promptly. It was inexpensive at $40, but very decent for the price. 

The bruschetta was very good, with the right amount of oil. I despise bruschetta that is so crunchy that the tomatoes go flying about the room when you take a bite. La Stalla's was excellent. 

My girlfriend had the Gorgonzola and sweet potato ravioli in cream sauce. I sampled a bit, and it was delicious (and I don't even like sweet potatoes!). She enjoyed it a great deal. 

I had the tortelloni aurora, with cheese, veal and prosciutto in a pink sauce. It wasn't *quite* as fabulous as my girlfriend's entree, but was very, very good nonetheless. 

We finished by sharing a creme brulee, which was also very good, though not particularly distinguished from any good creme brulee. 

The atmosphere was excellent, with the room full of adults and no screaming kids underfoot. The music was at volume appropriate to conversation, and the goldfish in the little pond behind our table were very polite.  Most people were dressed casually but not sloppily.

The service was EXCELLENT. Our waitress was clearly intelligent and perceptive, and attentive without being obtrusive. For example, when she noticed the girlfriend and I having a fun conversation, she politely asked if we wanted out entrees to come out quickly, or if we wanted to linger over our appetizer and wine a bit. She was quick with recommendations, had a ready smile, and served everything very efficiently. 

In all, it was about $120 with (a fairly generous, based on the excellent service) tip. I think the experience was worth every penny.

I walked in the day of my rehearsal and asked if they could accommodate my rehearsal dinner. They said absolutely and I was very ecstatic. Mind you, there were only 14 of us, but I still appreciated their flexibility.

The food and service were great. Everyone seemed very happy with their choices. It has a very nice ambiance and it was an unexpected but very appreciated find in Chandler.

Made a reservation which was pushed back past our time due to another party showing up late. Manager avoided me knowing they were wrong only to blame the hostess even after a waitress was told specifically to bring the manager up front. Only after the party who showed up 25min late was sat we were told we would be next. Failure from the top level made a party of 10 walk out the door. Management that bad should have followed us out the door.

Was here for a date last Friday...as always, I'll run through the pros and cons:

Pros: great wine, bread, and service.

Cons: paper table cloths (what on Earth??), food needs attention (scallops in my pasta could have been seared), and someone should be there to welcome you as you walk in (a hostess, anyone?).

If I were to go back, it would be for the wine!
Great light lunch at La Stalla's!  Love the relaxed atmosphere  & excellent service & food. Need to come back for dinner.
Have been going here for 10 years and never disappoints. Great happy hour, great pizza and killer lasagne. Also reasonable prices, try it.

Hands down my new favorite restaurant. Have only been twice so far, but have tried many items on the menu and everything has been delicious. Both times I went with a friend of the owner and he ordered a variety of items so we could sample a lot of things. 

The hi-lites include: the margherita pizza - I am probably forever ruined for any other pizza. The calamari - tender and tasty. The chicken marsala - would prefer it with pasta (came with veggies & potatoes) but absolutely delicious. The orechiette with eggplant, huge portion and so good. I don't eat proscuitto but my husband does and he absolutely loved it with the soft cheese appetizer (don't remember the name) - I did try the soft cheese and it was incredible.

First time we went the server gave us our bill without asking if we wanted dessert or coffee (which I was there with old world Italians so espresso at the end of the meal is a must) so that was a bit of a turnoff, but otherwise the service is good, ambience is great (live music on Friday night was lovely but a little loud).

They serve Illy coffee which is one of my favorites and always brings me back to my trip to Italy, and an Illy cappuccino is the perfect way to end the night IMO. Haven't tried the desserts yet but heard the tiramisu is amazing and will have that next time. Can't wait to go back again, and again.

I love this restaurant! It is easily one of the best kept secrets in Chandler. 

The problem I have is that I never know what entree to order, because they're all so delicious. They have a great wine selection, and delicious coffee and espresso. Regardless of what I end up ordering, I always have to finish my meal with Creme brûlée. Absolutely phenomenal. My sister claims the tiramisu is the best she's ever had, but I'm so hung up on my Creme brûlée I might never find out!

Some Sunday nights they have a guy named Matt playing guitar in there, we enjoy going in to see him. We usually go later in the night, around 7 or 8 and there is usually never a wait to get in. 

This place is an upgrade from your standard chain Italian restaurants, I highly recommend it!

I am someone who is half Italian and this place is ok. Not like my grandmothers cooking but slightly above the rest by offering authentic dishes. I had the Involitini de Melanzane. Which is eggplant rolotini with prosciutto. It was very good but beyond temperature hot. Too hot to even eat. Eggplant was light and the cheese was plentiful. Highly recommend this dish but ask for it out of the crock. It never seemed to cool off. My husband had the Tagliatelle alla Toscana. Which is basically fettuccine with a meat sauce. The sauce lacked some flavor, just couldn't put my finger on which flavor. Glad we tried this place, would go back if asked but wouldn't say it's a fav place of mine.
Awesome. The server was also amazing! The dishes were unbelievable.
Squid ink pasta here is legit. Perfectly balanced and great quality shellfish. Recommended.
This is a hidden gem. I love the atmosphere and feel. The food and prices are excellent. I would have given it 5 stars but the service wasn't at that level.

I tried, I really did. I wanted this to be a decent go to spot in the neighborhood. But it's just not working for me. 

The staff is amateur hour at best, inconsistent, and sometimes outright strange. 

Music is completely inappropriate- Tonight's choices were comprised of bad 70's mustache rock songs. 

The cooks don't really know what they're doing either. Lasagna was a strange overly salty cheesy mess. Pizza was a salty disaster too- Salty sausage, salty olives, salty capers, and salty prosciutto? Are you kidding me? Why? Why would anyone do that? Why would you put all of that on the same pizza? And why the hell did I order it? I've tried a couple other rather unremarkable dishes too. That's enough for me. I'll try to find another Italian place in the area. 

Oh, the prices are absurd for the entrees as well.

I have absolutely nothing bad to say! Food was outstanding the service and ambience were great! We will be going back for sure!

Note: their marinara sauce and calamari are amazing!!
The serive is great and the food is TO DIE FOR! It is a but pricey but it's worth every penny!
Went there for lunch on a Saturday afternoon. Excellent service, fantastic food! I highly recommend this place for some of the best Italian in the valley

We had a good experience for dinner here...no 5-star due to very average bread and side dish veggies that managed to be both overcooked and chewy (how do they do that???). We had a delicious rack of lamb and very fresh tasting grilled salmon...both cooked to perfection. The atmosphere was nice and our server was very friendly. Nothing earth shattering, just a nice meal.

We went here for Mother's Day and although they were under-staffed and the employees seemed over-worked, I was impressed how each employee handled every aspect of service with grace and patience. The food was delicious...we didn't take home leftovers bc we all finished our meals...and then enjoyed 3 different desserts! Ugh, so yummy! The entree portions are perfect; not too much and not too little. It's a cute and quaint restaurant in the heart of old town chandler. Great date night location; but it's probably a good idea to make reservations if it's on the weekend. 
Hope you enjoy this place as much as we did!

I've driven past La Stalla Cucina Rustica several times on my way to 98 South or El Zocalo but for some reason I'd never eaten there.  It might be the long, multi-syllabic name...places with names like that can be a little intimidating sometimes.  Still, I was in the mood for a different spot and Italian cuisine sounded good so I thought we'd give it a try.  I had the Penne alla Vodka.  Let's just say, my plate was clean at the end.  My experience with the service was really good. The only hiccup during our visit is that the glass of wine the person I was with ordered had little bits of cork in it.  I mentioned it to our server and they quickly apologized and replaced it.  No harm done!  We finished off having the tiramisu for dessert.   It had a really good flavor and the portion size was perfect for sharing.

My parent's live in Chandler and La Stalla is one of the reasons we visit them as often as we do...don't get me wrong, I love my parents - but if I'm going to drive from N. Phoenix, there better be some good food involved!

We started going to La Stalla a couple of years ago because everything else was so crowded...we were a little concerned that there might be a reason La Stalla wasn't crowded - but then again we were starving and so we chanced it. Thank goodness we did! It is one of the better Italian places in the valley...now the problem is if it gets too popular we won't be able to get in!

While I have ordered off the menu, I generally get the special...I have had exceptional Salmon - crispy on the outside, slightly pink, moist  and tender on the inside...Also, one night the special was wild boar, so you know I had to try it - it was fantastic. Also, the pizzas are really good if you like more down to earth eating. All in all, a great place - we need more like it in the Valley.

I really wanted to like this place. I found the calamari to be chewy and undercooked. Minestrone was bland. Chicken Marsala was lacking flavor as well. My boyfriend had the pasta & fagioli which was very tasty and pasta carbonera, which was also very tasty. The server was attentive and kept glasses and breadbaskets full. The hostess needs to go. We were seated facing her and she spent the entire time twirling her hair and picking at her split ends looking bored to death. Would I go back? Probably not, there are plenty of other restaurants to try.

Food was very good however I ordered a half/lunch portion of the gnocchi and literally got  about 8 gnocchi served on my plate. Too bad because it was so delish. For $11 I thought I'd get a little more food. My husband ordered a pizza, good size, and it was very good. Service good not great.

Great for a date night.  When I say date night it's because a bit pricey.  We've been coming here for gosh about a decade.  We've been here with groups of 2 to 20 people.  It's a smaller restaurant, so I give grace when there's a large crowd!  I would like to see more gluten friendly options.  It's a sweet place in the heart of Chandler.  I appreciate it's not a chain restaurant.  I would agree the hostesses do need a bit of coaching... the customer is always right!  The food has been really good.

I was pleasantly surprised to find such a classy old-world Italian eatery so close to home. La Stalla is in the heart of historic Downtown Chandler, kitty-corner to the San Marcos hotel. 

Here's my recommendation for the perfect dinner, ala a night in Venice, without leaving the Valley:

Start with the Bocconcini al Prosciutto, prosciutto-wrapped mozzarella topped with mushrooms and breadcrums. 

Contadino focaccia, with grilled eggplant, roasted peppers, with mozzarella, mesculine and tomatoes, drizzled with a balsamic olive oil dressing.

Penne alla Vodka, al dente penne pasta in a delicate vodka-cream sauce. 

Finish off with fresh fruit zabaione or (maybe and?) chocolatte souffle. You'll have to allow an extra 10-15 minutes for the souffle, but it comes straight out of the oven.

Delizioso!

We started with the mozzarella, prosciutto and mushroom bake. It was fantastic. The Cavatelli, Broccoli and Sausage was very good.  The tagliatelle  with meat sauce was ok.  Portion sizes were huge - enough for lunch the next day.

A bit surprised they don't make their own pasta. 

Service was very friendly and we sat out on the patio. 

It was a while between visits but we'll be back again.

OMG!  I can't believe I forgot my review of this place.  My sis and I were have a sister day, and we picked this place for lunch on Martin Luther King day.  I am assuming that is why it was dead, the courts and offices in downtown Chandler were closed.  

The hostess/waitress was very friendly and helpful.  She let us taste a couple wines before deciding on ours, and the pours were generous.  We started with Brucchetta that was only 3 pieces to the order, so if you have a party of 4 you are screwed.  The tomato/basil topping was fresh and delish.

 I ordered Butternut Squash ravioli in a cream sauce.  It was soooo good, although there was too much cream sauce poured on top, my ravioli were buried.  But they tasted soooo good.  My sis had penne pasta with tomato sauce and zucchini.  It was very good, but HUGE portions!  She boxed it up so we could have dessert.  We chose the chocolate souffle that was served with vanilla ice cream.  It was so rich and decadent!  It went perfectly with our Illy coffee and cream!

I can't wait to take my husband here!  I want to go back for dinner because they have gnocchi!  They do have a great $5 weekday lunch menu with cold or hot sandwiches and pizza.

Absolutely Exquisite. Perfect service. Every bite was delicious. We had sea bass and the sweet potato ravioli. Crazy good. Lovely atmosphere and right down to the bread and  vinegar everything was wonderful. Yum!! Definitely going back.

What's going on here? My uncle took eight of us here for my anniversary and we had to literally beg for butter, cheese, bread and water. Are we in jail??? Our waitress was a loon, Fredriko or something like that. Not sure she was in the moment. Appetizer was slapped on a plate. Silverware was missing. Stupid paper covering the tablecloth cut my son's finger. Really hard chairs. I was crippled by the end of the night. Good wine and bread, when you can get it. Come on, get on track. This was one weird meal.
This Is what a nice Italian restaurant is supposed to be.  We were so happy to find this gem is chandler!  Great food, though a little pricey, but well definitely be back!

This is one place I'm really looking forward to going back to. We went on Sunday afternoon for lunch, the place wasn't busy but I could see how it would be slammed in the evening. 

The decor is warm, inviting, authentic and immaculately clean. Our server Valerie was just a doll and made great recommendations, and they have coke products to that was already a thumbs up.

My fiancé ordered the Calzone which he really liked, and I got chicken marsala, also very good my only one suggestion was that my chicken was overcooked but the flavor was great. 

We will definitely be back for dinner one night.
Better than Olive Garden, that's for sure! We enjoyed our late lunch here, we were seated right by he fountain and we enjoyed our food and the bread. Hostess was really nice, will definitely be back
This is a great restaurant. We ate here several times. Great food, ambience and location. Very polite staff.

The food was fantastic!  The ambiance was good, especially since it was crowded on Valentines Day.  The reason why this review is a 3 star vs a 4 or 5 is because of the service.  It wasn't terrible, but it wasn't the caliber that I would expect from a restaurant of this quality and that would be consistent with the prices (which are reasonable).  I would absolutely go back as the sweet potato ravioli I had was incredible.  The server might have been busy, had a bad day, etc. but she seemed dis-interested in taking the time to listen to what we were ordering (drinks and entrees mixed up), and in general did not provide great service.  Good experience, but could have been great...

Pretty cool joint.  The pastas seem fresh and the sauces are tasty.  I like the atmosphere.  I'll be back !

Ya feel me?

A small group went there for dinner yesterday.The place is cute, really well located and the food was really good.
 I ordered the gnocchi and it was delicious. Foe dessert I had the chocolate souffle - one of the best I ever had.
I am not giving it a five star because the service could have been better. The waitress took her time to come and take our orders, I had to specifically ask her to take our bread basket and appetizer plates away when the main course arrived. My friend ordered half portion of gnocchi with her entree and she had a strange reaction - as if she "disagreed" with the order. Oh well...maybe next time she will be in a better mood.

LOVE THIS PLACE!!  I go here every year for my Birthday dinner.  Had the sweet potato gorgonzola ravioli last year, It was fan-freakin-tastic!  Can't wait to go again this year.  And their lunch specials are wonderful too.

The only place in the east valley that my Italian New Jersey grandmother approves as "real Italian!" I love the lasagna and pizza. The bread and salads are also tasty! The only negative is their hard wooden chairs for a long dinner. You can request cushions but they are still pretty hard.

1)  Authentic Italian food.
2) This place is amazing.
3) The service is among the best.
Grazie ,finalmente abbiamo mangiato come si deve.A prestissimo

Well I hate to be the bearer of bad news ,but I had an awful experience here and it makes me hesitant to EVER go back despite the good reviews for dinner and dessert.

I went for lunch with my husband. I wanted to see the menu first but he wanted to just go for it.

It's very cute inside, I Loved the Mediterranean/Romantic feel with lighted orange trees and faux rock walls, wood beams and rustic chairs.

I HATE paper table cloths, as they are prone to giving paper cuts and always make me think of Macaroni Grille.

I was not feelin' the menu but decided to try one of their Focaccia Panini's with grilled chicken, tomato, avocado and spinach. My husband ordered pasta with Tuscan meat sauce.

First we were served flat diet coke and some day old bread.......sigh.....

Good rustic bread is sometimes chewy and maybe even tough, but never just crumbles the way this bread did...maybe it was more than day old?

My sandwich arrived and looked OK (notice no picture) After one bite I knew it wasn't good, but I took a few more just to make sure. 

The spinach looked to be from a can or frozen, it was really mushy and the green color was looking really more of a brownish.

My husband's pasta was piping  hot and he said it was OK also but had a weird taste to the meat..??

SO I didn't eat anymore of mine and when the waitress/manager/hostess came over I told her why (spinach and just overall not good) She insisted it was Fresh..............Honey Please! 

Maybe last week when they sauteed it but now it was a soggy mess.

I Love spinach and I assure you there is NO WAY that spinach was fresh at any time during the last week!

My Husband says I need to YELP on my own time!

2 stars for the decor
Had my birthday dinner there.  Love their chicken marsala.  Ate at the bar which is my wife's and my favorite thing to do.  Always great service and food.
Pretty good food, okay prices, and a nice dining atmosphere.  Service was decent also.

I am from the east coast (an hour from NYC) and from an Italian family and would defiantly eat here again. The only true Italian I have found in this area. I had the cavatilla and broccoli and it was just like my nuna used to make it with some yummy sausage pieces thrown in there as well. We made reservations for 6:30 on a Friday and glad we did. The place was packed! For sure will be coming back to this place again and again.

We dropped in last night for happy hour after checking out the farmer's market in Downtown Chandler. Happy hour goes until 6pm (half priced apps and pizzas!!), and since it was pretty close to that time, we were given menus and waited on right away. We decided on the margherita pizza and bocconcini al prosciutto (read mozzarella sticks wrapped in proscuitto topped with mushrooms and breadcrumbs, not fried). 

Soon after ordering, we were brought fresh slices of bread and some balsamic vinegar. After mixing the balsamic with the olive oil that was already at the table, we quickly devoured most of the bread.

It didn't take too long for the food to come. The "cheese sticks" came out first. Different from anything I've had before, but they were quite tasty...we fought over the mushrooms that topped the 3 cheese sticks. The pizza shortly followed, and it was big enough for 3 people to share (not bad for $5)! We agreed that the pizza was good, but nothing too special. It had a crushed tomato sauce with scattered fresh basil, smothered in mozzarella cheese on a thin crust and cooked in a brick oven. It was a great pizza for the price; if I go back, I'd like to try one of their other pizzas.

The bill was less than $20 for the pizza, appetizer, a glass of wine and a glass of beer. Not to mention we were pretty full. The atmosphere is cozy and romantic, with low lighting. The service was pretty good, although it took forever to get our check- I was quickly becoming inpatient. I'm not sure if I'd rush back there, but if you're in the area around happy hour time I'd suggest giving it a shot!

Hubby and I went to this place on a dinner date. Its a cute little restaurant. I wasnt wowed by the food though. The calamari was too tender not as crispy or fried as i like it. 

They dont even give you bread to start, they did offer some during our meal though. The place was good, just not great, i would not go back again by choice.

This was our second visit to La Stalla.  The atmosphere is so appropriate for the menu.  Our waiter was so attentive.  And the food.....wow.  I had the sweet potato tortellini with Gorgonzola sauce.  Out of this world.  My husband had the salmon penne and loved it.  Our friends had two different sandwiches.  So big they took half home.  Thank you La Stalla, we will be back next year.

Love, love, love. Haven't had a bad item here. The pasta e fagioli is to die for. The gnocchi is delectable. The ambiance is lovely. Generally a quiet spot. The service is good. My boyfriend's food came out a little later than the rest, so they brought us a round of lemoncello shots on the house. It is clear these people take pride in what they do. I will come here time and time again. Brought my parents, and they loved it. Location is great; nestled in the heart of downtown Chandler.

Went there for lunch time after someone recommend me this place. The service was really slow and the servers were not busy. We order a beer and a strawberry margarita to start and when the drink came it wasn't a strawberry margarita, was a regular one. When we asked the server he told us they didn't had anymore strawberry so they put some orange instead !?! Anyway, we start with a starter and then 3 main courses. The starter was tasty. The main courses: 
First was good size but too salty.
Second one small size but tasty.
Third one good size but no flavor.
So that's why 3, I'm kind of between two options about this place.

To write I have to select a star. Seems after years of not visiting and hoping for an awesome experience as it had been over the previous visits! Totally a zero experience- slow but enthusiastic server - just to be simple with my review and not waste a lot of words or time with this please read the reviews that are 3 stars or less. We were so disappointed that we skipped desert.

Beautiful restaurant, it made me forget that I was in Arizona. Love the rustic wood chairs, iron chandeliers, and stone work on the walls. Stunning! Excellent bread and amazing olive oil. I had the spinach pasta with scallops, mushrooms and a cherry tomato sauce. It was good but I felt like it was missing something. I guess it just need a kick. My boyfriend had the lasagna and he said it was good but not amazing like the server described. We will be back since I would like to try some other items on their menu.

The first time I went here, the food was pretty good and I really had no complaints.  The second time - What the heck happened???  The name of the game that night was how much salt can you ingest in one meal before a stroke occurred?  Everything was a salt bomb.  Especially the seafood pasta where beside the gross, old mussels the only spice I could taste was salt.  The sad part is - I love salt!  I won't go back or recommend it to anyone who has hypertension.

Menu is extensive with lovely selections and nice wine offerings. Even though there were few diners,  service was sluggish. Our party of three waited more than 20 minutes after appetizer had long been finished. Food arrived warm but we were not up to complaining as we had waited so long. Servers were pleasant and we will give this Chandler establishment another chance. We live so close so would be great if we could could visit this restaurant weekly.

This was a terrible restaurant. I went by the reviews which looked so good. The Calamari was terrible, my quest ordered Gnocchi I believe she couldn't even eat it and it looked like an appetizer, I had a Pork Chop, the sauce was fine but the Chop was so over cooked I could hardly cut it with a steak knife.The waiter asked my guest for parmesan and didn't even use freshly grated parmesan? That's hardly Authentic Italian? My guest had two glasses of wine, I had tea, the bill was $100.00? Wow? The waiter very pleasant and the atmosphere was nice. It was the worst food I've had at a restaurant in a very long time. I did tip the waiter 20% because he was pleasant. $120.00 for food we couldn't even eat, that's bad.

One of the best Italian restaurants to dine in. I had calamari as an appetizer, the marinara sauce is freshly made and delicious with the calamari. Also I was craving chicken fettuccine alfredo. It was not on the menu but I did ask the server and he said he would ask the cooks in the back if they could whip some up. Sure enough, they were pleased to do that for me! It was beyond amazing! The alfredo sauce was made to order and the chicken was very tender, fettuccine was al dente, just how I like it! I will be coming here for my Italian cravings. Overall great experience with the service and everything!

Can't help but feel let down after eating at La Stalla last Friday night, especially after all the positive reviews. I have to say that the best thing about this place was the location and drinks. Here's how I would break it down:

Location: 4 stars
Price: 2 stars
Food: 2 stars
Drinks: 4 stars
Service: 2.5 stars

First of all, we got here around 6pm on a Friday night and we were probably one of three couples and a large party. Basically, this place wasn't super busy.

 Our waitress was very friendly and kept checking back at the perfect times. But the waitress didn't make up for the near one hour wait time for a single plate of pasta, which even the waitress admitted was long.

After waiting that long for the pasta you would think the noodles would be done but they were still pretty chewy. In addition to the pasta we also got the antipasto, which was three types of meats and three types of cheeses and two olives. It wasn't served with any nuts/fruits/jams or breads, so we used the leftover bread we had from when we first walked in. 

I do have to say the drinks were absolutely fantastic - definitely one of the few positives. We had a mixture of cocktails and wine and they both were amazing.

Lastly, the thing that really made our mind up about La Stalla was the price. For two people we ordered a single plate of pasta, the antipasto, and two drinks for both of us and the bill was an astounding $95 after tip. Definitely not recommended when you compare the food for the price.

Do NOT get the calamari. It has no flavor and it is rubbery. I doubt I will come here again. I wasn't blown away by the food. The service was bad. We had to wait forever for our check because the server was too busy with the large obnoxious party sitting next to us. Our server did not seem to know how to multi task. If you want really good service and amazing food, go to Pestos pizza and wine bar.

I was looking forward to eating here and was expecting to enjoy it. Unfortunately, the service was very disappointing. Maybe they were very understaffed, but my water was left empty and the server/ bartender rarely came to our table, brought us the wrong appetizer, etc... The food was decent, but not amazing. We had bruschetta, gnocchi, and the sweet potato ravioli. I had the ravioli and the sauce was very salty, however the ravioli tasted great.  Overall, it was okay, but if I want Italian food  I will be better off going somewhere else in the future.

We dined on 9/22/12 which was my husband's birthday dinner, and we had a party of 4.  I must say the service was incredible!!!  We had made reservations and our table was waiting for us when we arrived.  My husband ordered the fettucine, which was by far the best dish at the table.  They make their own pasta at this place, so the fettucine noodles were purple and had the white sauce (awesome by the way) topped with pine nuts and sliced cherry tomatoes.  I had a dish, which was the special, and while it was cooked well, it wasn't as fantastic as the fettucine dish, just my preference, not digging on the dish itself.  The others at the table ordered the lasagna, which was a pretty big portion, and it was delicious as well.  We had wine and an italian beer called Moretti La Rossa.  The beer was so good, we went to Total Wine a few days later and got a couple of 6 packs.  We were there into the end of the evening (10 pm), so our server asked if we'd like some homemade almond liqueur, and we said yes.  It was fantastic!!  It came in a little shot glass and was so very wonderful.  We thought they were going to charge us for these, but they didn't.  It was a sort of pricey place, but so very worth the great food, and we were prepared to pay since it was a birthday celebration. A special place to dine for sure.  I'd been here on other occasions and the food was good, but they must have upped their game since then, as they went from 4 stars to 5 stars.

If the service wouldn't have so poor it would have been hilarious! Despite our server's arrival with great enthusiasm, it went down hill from there.He even wanted to let us know that was not your usual pasta place with regular spaghetti etc... How's that for an insult to your customers?  I like basic pasta places and I am capable of discerning between types of food. Our food arrived cold and we had to send all entrees back to the kitchen. Our server was nowhere to be found and we had to request another server to come to our table and take the food back. It appears there is no bus staff or management as well! Our server seemed overwhelmed! Our salad plates were not cleared before entrees came out and he had to set down our entrees on a table next to us to clear the dirty plates. Speaking of dirty plates my sisters appetizer plate was dirty when it arrived as was her fork with residual food.  I requested another glass of wine and he took my empty glass and went to attend to another table and set my dirty glass on their table while he took an order from them! My sister asked for decaf coffee and a dessert menu and she was told there was no decaf!  He said I can try and make you some if you want!!! Are you kidding me??? In a restaurant of this caliber no coffee made?? We asked to share two desserts for four people. Perhaps they were low on forks and spoons because we got two spoons for all of us to share. We are a close family but I want my own cutlery when dining out. At one point we thought we might have been a reality TV show because it was so ridiculous. We love fine dining and were so looking forward to going here!  
We came in from California for this!  My son and daughter have both been servers and we are great supporters of the service industry so I would encourage La Stalla to hire some bus boys so your servers can do the job they need to do.

Love this restaurant!  The manicotti is my favorite!  It has nice decor and a romantic setting.  Resonably priced.  It is popular so there is usually a wait on Friday and Saturday nights.  I recommend reservations for those evenings.
Service was excellent. The food was delicious. Great place for a large group or a small intimate dinner. Love this place. Authentic Italian food.
our first time here! and omg the most delicious Italian dishes ive ever eaten! and great service too, thx to our waiter Jeff. we will def come back often!!

My wife was given a great recommendation on this place, WOW were they ever wrong, as a Northeast person, raised in an Italian household this is NOT Great, Good or even mediocre Italian food. 1st the hostess would not wait on us because she doesn't like my daughters, had a waiter seat US. Then were we sat in a table pushed closer to other tables with a large area open in the middle, why??? I do not know!! As for the service it was OK, at least our waitress didn't screw up the orders! 
The food however never again, Calamari were huge, pre frozen rings (see Costco ) not fried well at all, chewy and bad flavor, marinara sauce was horrible. Dinners were ok, best was the sweet potato ravioli my daughter had, rest were 2 star at best, I had the grilled lamb chops bought from Costco, I know because I've bought them their too not worth the $28.00. Desserts were good, best was the limoncello  Flute. 
Worst was watching a couple try to get a table for at least an hour as the hostess said they were waiting for our table to leave? Excuse Me!! There were tables open, and when it was 1st told to this couple we were just getting our dinners! 
To write a review you need to place a star, if I had a choice it would be 0 stars. It I guess the Ravioli and dessert deserve 1 star!! 
If you are looking for a local great Italian restaurant do go here!!

UPDATE: 2/26/17, I was threatened by the stepdad of the hostess, he felt my comments were wrong,I asked him if he was threatening all the people who had an issue with her or just me?? No response! Moral here is there are crazy people out there so be careful, this is no joke and Rick the owner of LaStalla could care less that a customer has been threatened by an employees family!!
Beautiful inside. Amazing food. Great service. The only thing wrong is a small menu and it takes time to make.
Nice Italian restaurant and great food, good for business lunches as the ambient is private and quiet and you end being a very good host.

Can't believe it's taken me this long to write a review for La Stalla Cucina Rustica.

If you're looking for delicious Italian food that doesn't resemble the corporate garbage that's strewn about the area, then look no further! 

Seriously, though, the food here reminds me of my Nana's cooking . . . And that's damn near impossible to compete with. 

A quaint little spot for a date night in Downtown Chandler, yet affordable. Very charming décor inside. Yes, the paper table coverings are annoying and scream "MACARONI GRILL!", but that's the least of your worries when you come to a place like this.  

Every time we go here, we always have the same server. Feeling like an idiot because I can't remember her name! She always recommends great wine for us, and is even generous enough to let us taste before committing to a bottle or glass. *Edit: Her name is Tina, and she is amazing!*

The last time I was in five or so months ago, found out that LSCR started making their own bread. Better than whatever they had before! Always comes out fresh, warm and fluffy. Have to get that thing out of sight after a piece it's that good. 

The few times we've been here we've tried the Ravioli Di Patate Dolci Giapponesi Al Gorgonzola, Risotto Agli Scampi and Costolette D'Agnello alla Griglia,  and a Manicotti that was on special. 

Everything was excellent; however, our absolute favorite was the first thing I listed: Japanese sweet potato ravioli in a Gorgonzola cheese cream sauce. WOW! 

Definitely need a nap after this rich dish. Still haven't gotten around to recreating it at home. The sweet potato blended surprisingly well with something as rich as Gorgonzola. 

If you want to do dessert, try the Chocolate Souffle. Hello, dark chocolate heaven! Make sure you give your server a heads up, as it takes 15 minutes for this one. Patience! 

Great selection of after dinner drinks too. Think grappa and homemade limoncello!

The almond flavored grappa was awesome.  Brought back memories of visiting family in Varrazze years ago and being introduced to it by my Nana's cousin after a ridiculously indulgent meal. Yeah, smooth move dude . . . extra potent alcohol for a bunch of 18-20 year old WILD college kids! 

Check it out. You won't be disappointed. And if you are, you're probably an Olive Garden fan. :)
Professional service and great pasta with a great wine selection. Their pizza was good but not the best in valley.

I found this place via Yelp because we needed a place to meet some friends in downtown Chandler.  This was the winner.  Though a bit pricey for the average person, the food definitely made up and was delicious!

I ordered the lasagna.  it came out piping hot in a dish and was incredible. Probably the best Ive had outside of home made.  A buddy of mine ordered the pizza and it too was great.  

i wasn't a fan of their bread so much that they give out before hand.  But it's always nice to have something before the main course.

I will definitely go here again!

Went here for our anniversary a party of 8. Everyone ordered different food items and everyone enjoyed their food. It was a wonderful evening for all.
Excellent service was provided by Cami.

I enjoyed the ambiance of La Stalla. The service was great. Our waitress knew the menu very well and made us feel at home all evening. We got the calamari appetizer, which was perfectly cooked and delicious. I got the gnocchi and it may have been the best gnocchi I have ever had. My wife got the chicken parmesan which was also very good. The only complaints we had were; it seemed to take a long time for our food to come out and it was a little on the pricey side. 4 entrees, an app, a salad, a dessert, 4 waters and no alcohol . Our bill was over $100, before the tip.

What can I say about this place?  Amazing describes it pretty well.

There were eight of us for lunch.  We were seated promptly.  Our server was fantastic and the food delicious.  That just about describes our whole time.

We loved the location of this restaurant too.  It was right in the heart of Chandler.  Tablecloths were on all the tables, it was clean and inviting.

The menu was a little different than other Italian restaurants but staff was willing to make changes as we ordered.  Everything was perfect.  Food came out on time and we were left to talk with friends for as long as we wanted.  Fantastic!

Very disappointing! Went for dinner on Friday night. Group of gf celebrating a birthday. Our waiter was nice but was not willing to make one single change as in substitutions. My gf wanted asparagus instead of the vegetable side. Absolutely not!! He charged her 4.00 for three asparagus. Salads are not included with the meals, although the waiter acted as if they were when asking us if we wanted one. If you order the sea bass be sure to have bread near by...full of bones!  Usually a restaurant will do a little something for a bday, he gave us a menu for desert. 50.00 a piece, not impressed. Will not return.

I am VERY VERY picky about eating out at italian restaurants but La Stalla definitely made the grade.  The bread was very flavorful and satisfying and the sweet potato ravioli was magnificent.  Prices were very reasonable as well plus the service was great.

Not too bad!! Would go back!! 

First off this place is located in downtown Chandler, which I love the area and it fits right in. It's located on buffalo street right across from San Marcos hotel. It's a small little restaurant with a warm feel.  Right off the bat I was very surprised by the ambience. Staff was extremely friendly so no issues there.  

On to the food.  I ordered the Cavatelli Pasta with Sausage, broccoli, in a garlic sauce.  While the dish was decent it didn't blow me away.  It didn't meet the standards not the wow factor that the decor gave me.  It left me wanting for more.  Not more food as the serving was sufficient just  more flavor.  Prices wasn't bad as my meal was 10.00. But it was more on the bland side and the pasta itself was a little tough.  I left full but not entirely satisfied.  

Overall I would visit again and perhaps just order a different dish as my friend had the salmon and mentioned it was delicious.

5 stars - really? This Italian gem is a wonderful authentic masterpiece. Not your normal dishes which make it all the more excellent. The tortellini soup is amazing and the many pasta dishes are wonderful. Located in beautiful downtown Chandler, this is a gem. Did I metioned the outstanding service? Not the cheapest in town but the quality, service and Atmosphere are worth it.

Went here on a date and I was impressed with the intimate feel and ambiance the restaurant had. It was quite inside and the decor really made you feel like you were eating in a Tuscan restaurant. Service started off slightly slower through the beverage round but he was friendly and made suggestions based on what we may eat for dinner. We started off with some Caprese and it was delicious... The mozzarella was soooo good! We had the Lasagna and Tagliatelle alla Toscana pasta for our meals and they were both excellent and so full of flavor. Best I have had... REALLY. Overall really good fun experience and will definitely be back.

Came here with my family for lunch on a saturday and had their margarita pizza, squid ink pasta with shellfish and japanese sweet potato ravioli. The pizza was pretty tasty and good portion for the lunch special price of $8. However, the japanese sweet potato ravioli, eventhough also tasty, but portion size was terribly disappointing for the price we paid--$14. There were exactly 5 small pieces of it! The good taste couldn't make up for the small amount of food. Lastly, the squid ink pasta was a good portion, taste was ok but plain, nothing exotic about it. Pretty disappointed with the experience. 

Bread was supposedly fresh baked daily but ours came cold, another disappointment. Did not taste like warm fresh baked bread to us at all. 

Service was ok, but could be better. Server left the wine list menu laying flat on our table the entire time and even place a plate of sliced lemons on it instead of removing it.
Given that my wife grew up in Chandler, I was surprised that we hadn't found this place earlier.  Awesome!
Great service by Tina! Food was so good - sweet potatoe ravioli and chicken parm. Her recommendations were spot on. And splurge and eat the bread...worth it!
If I could give zero stars I would, had a reservation, and they failed to honor it. Terrible customer service.

Have to support Malone D. on this one. Food was only ok and was overpriced. Service - was *very* good - while we were the only ones in the restaurant. As soon as the usual Saturday night crowd arrived and the place started to fill-up, the quality of service and attention dropped off fast. No more refills on drinks and long wait to get check paid.
Antipasto plate was small and overpriced and of average quality. Pasta Fagouli soup was all shells, some beans and tasted like ti came from a can. Very disappointing,. Pasta + pancetta - the pancetta was tough and gristle-y and the pesto only so-so. Would not return.

I love this place. I've been here several times over the years and it has never disappointed. Most recently I came here with my sisters and friends after my baby shower on a Saturday night. We were seated immediately and service was great. The food was amazing as always. I love the salad with the pear and walnuts! I remembered how amazing it was years ago and I was so happy it is still on the menu. All 5 of us were very impressed with the food and service that night! I wish I could afford to eat here every night.

So yes...it was "A-OK."  It wasn't great...I don't think it came even close to the hype.  It wasn't bad...it just wasn't great.

The table shared a couple of Caprese Salad's...there was one single leaf of basil in the center of the plate.  The tomato's were dark pink (if we can get bright red tomato's in Minneapolis in the winter, why can't they get ripe tomato's in Chandler?).  Again...it was ok, but I expected more.

I had a "primevera" salad that was comprised of mixed greens, apples, orange, and grapefruit with a creamy raspberry dressing, but it was saturated in blue cheese crumbles that completely overtook the salad.  

My entree was a broiled halibut and came with a generous portion of mixed vegetables that were overcooked.  The halibut was simple and tasty, but it was also tiny - probably the smallest portion of halibut I've ever been served.

I had a nice glass of Pinot Noir; the only one they served by the glass on the menu.

So, all in all...it was ok.  I wouldn't even think of driving out of my way to go there again though.

I came in there once on Valentine's day which happened to be Friday, the restaurant was packed, so I didn't get seated and decided to come back. 

The actual visit was such a disappointment. The bread was served cold, it wasn't even warm. The very sad lasagna was cold in the middle, seems like it was thawed before serving. The lasagna wasn't impressive, tomato sauce was too sweet, and not enough meat. Sweet potato ravioli in gorgonzola sauce were interesting, but not interesting enough to pay $21 for six raviolis: sweet potatoes were too sweet, the dish was lukewarm, not hot. Olive oil on the table tasted stale, their balsamic vinegar gave me a heartburn (I have better one at home).

The decor is outdated. 

The server, Dennis, tried to play a role of a server from a better restaurant than La Stalls is; I prefer more authentic and genuine attitude. But more importantly, I prefer my food served hot, especially on Monday evenings, when they have only few tables seated.

Three-star Buca di Beppo, being a chain, has more ambiance, more flavor in their Italian dishes than this downtown Chandler 'gem'. Needless to say, servers at Buca were always more delightful than "I am going to act arrogant, so they'll think this is high-end restaurant" attitude. It makes me really wonder how this place stays in business and get such high reviews!

We were a little disappointed tonight.  Although we had good service, the food was just not of the quality we remember from a few years ago.  My steak tips were not tender and the beef was not flavorful or of good quality.  Not sure we will return.

Well first, the gentleman poured me an exquisite glass of chianti. The soup was made of beans and pasta. It was so well done it made me want to cry.  The bread was served with a tough pepper mill and balsamic and oil that was perfect. I ordered the ink and squid. Gotta say, Le mussels were perfect. The dyed pasta was al dente and delicious. I had a mug of Italian coffee. Perfect. I savoured a hazelnut liqueur and waited for the food to settle.  The bill wad affordable. While seeming a high end restaurant, the price and the flavor did not match. I expected it to be much more expensive. I would have paid more. I sat there a many while moments contiplating before getting a gin straight up and dirty. Great service to the end. The maestro had no problem sending me hone with extra bread. Well done. I will come back soon.

My husband and I had dinner there last night for the first time.  We live pretty close by and was hoping for a good experience so we could frequent this place often.  It was way above our expectations.  I am an italian food stob, so it better be good or I won't go back.  Our pasta dishes were outstanding and service very good.  The restaurant was very busy but the hostess got us a table at the bar.  Will definitely become a regular.

I really really enjoyed my experience here. 

It's a really nice little restaurant, great service, super nice "date night" atmosphere without breaking the bank.

I myself had a pasta dish and the pasta was cooked nicely, the sauce was light with some meat in it. The garlic bread on the side was delicious and fresh. No complaints on my food.

Our server was nice, attentive and was able to answer our questions about the menu easily and quickly. 

When you find a solid place to have good food, you know it and for me, this is it.
Love the food.  Everything taste so fresh and the tiramisu is the best I ever had!!!!

We went here for a business dinner tonight.  There is a nice bar area you can relax in if you are not ready to eat. We were hungry so we decided to sit in the dining area and we ordered Mussels and Antipasto and drinks. We had a great waitress who really hustled to keep the drinks and food coming all night. La Stalla has a nice cozy atmosphere and the food is very good. I had the Filet with Asparagus and it was cooked perfectly. The Gnocchi is especially good here. We all enjoyed our food and the atmosphere and the service is excellent. We will come back in the future to try some more dishes.
Our favorite Italian in the East Valley. Everything on the menu is made in-house and the food is fabulous!!
Omg this place!!!! The Japanese sweet potato ravioli was out of this world!! I will be back!! Try it, you won't be disappointed!!

We have been to this restaurant at least a dozen times. It is consistently delicious. The homemade pastas are amazing (try the carbonara and the sweet potato ravioli) and the burrata appetizer is delicious. Also try the eggplant mellanzane. Great for couples and families.

If this is authentic, true Italians will be ashamed. Even the iced tea taste poorly, I've had better marinara from a can. Service was mediocre. May be better for dinner. The wifey and I shall never return.

This place is amazing. Found it while searching for a place to eat outside the norm in Downtown Chandler. Already had appetizers elsewhere so cannot say how they are here. I took the recommendation and ordered the special of the day, couldn't be more pleased. Swordfish was very flavorful and cooked perfectly. Not sure if it's on the menu, but it should be. Definitely worth  drive. Can't wait to come back and see what else is on the menu.

Had dinner there on March 17 I love the atmosphere and food .Tina was our waitress and the service was outstanding we did have a large group of people 15 or more the only reason the place didn't get five stars was the point-of-sale system which took 30 minutes to get the Individual checks.

I really wanted to love this restaurant.  It's local and has a nice atmosphere (except for the paper on top of the table cloth....my 8 year old even said, "this paper is unpleasant.")  

It was my 72 year old mother-in-law's birthday.  I stopped in on my way to pick my son up from school to check out the restaurant and menu.  When I went in I wondered if they were open as nobody was around.  Finally I got the attention of the bar tender who gave me a paper menu to take along and talked up the owners and food as truly authentic Italian.

I arrived before my husband, who was bringing our son, mother-in-law and father-in-law (who is in a wheelchair).  The hostess was very nice and set up a table that was easy to access/room for the wheelchair.  The restaurant was busy which included at least two large parties of 8 plus in the dinning room.  We sat down and waited ....waters....waited...oh you need menus.....waited and waited....drink order...waited and waited...drinks came out hand carried one or two at a time...ugh.

The waitress was pleasant but seemed to be taking care of most of the tables even though there seemed to be plenty of other staff around.  Anyway, the special dinner item was kangaroo.  None of us felt like going there....is kangaroo an "authentic Italian" dish?  

We ordered the Anitpaso Italiano to start which was very good, but a really tiny plate for the price.  The bread basket was a complimentary thin, short little bread for our table of 5.  My husband also ordered a bowl of minestrone.  The soup was bland and overpowered by the taste of the overcooked broccoli in the soup.  Never had Minestrone with broccoli (and peas).

My father-in-law had the Costolette D'Agnello alla Griglia (lamb chops) accompanied by the "fresh" vegetable of the day.  He ate the lamb chops not the veggies.  The veggies were awful and strange.  It's like they were boiled and overcooked (cabbage, potato, zucchini & carrot) except the carrot was undercooked and hard.

My mother-in-law had the Spaghetti alla Carbonara.  She ate it.   Didn't complain about it, but it looked heavy (too thick) and beige.

I had the Pappardelle Marie Monti (spinach pasta, Scallops & porcini mushrooms in an "imported" light cherry tomato sauce).  Bland, oily and the scallops would have been nice with a sear on each side.

My husband and son split the Pollo al Marsala...which the menu says is pan seared.  The chicken was almost certainly boiled with like a mushroom, butter gravy added afterward.  No marsala flavor.  This also came with the awful and strange "fresh" vegetable of the day.

The service was painfully slow for everything even after the bigger parties had cleared out.  No offer for a second glass of wine, and refills on soft drinks was next to impossible as the waitress had no support (buss staff, etc.).   We had dirty dinner plates even while we ate our little cupcake I brought to put a candle in for grandma's birthday.  Good thing too, because we were not offered dessert.  I did manage to get a coffee, which was brought out black (no spoon or cream).  There was sugar on the table from earlier and when I asked for cream..."oh, you need cream"....stirred the cream in with one of the forks I didn't use from dinner.  

As an afterthought the waitress brought a couple of fresh plates and forks for our cupcakes, but it was too little too late.  The check was brought over and we never saw the waitress again.  Guess it was a good thing we paid cash and didn't need change.  We got up to leave (not a fast moving group) and there was not any staff waitress, hostess, bartender who said goodbye, thank you, have a good night.  In fact I thought this was so strange, I yelled back into the restaurant goodbye, your welcome....still not one staff member turned their head to acknowledge  me.

Not going back...what a shame...I REALLY wanted to like this place.

Overall rating : I rated the restaurant three out of five stars because the food was not up to the standards I expect. 
ambience: The restaurant was clean and nicely appointed.  The flatware was of notably good quality. The weight and balance felt great in my hands. The tables were too close together to offer any privacy. I found it hard not to overhear my neighbors conversations.
Service : The service was good. I requested heavy cream for my coffee and was disappointed when the waiter told me they only had the milk without checking with the kitchen first.
Food: My friend and I both ordered chicken marsala. The chicken was tough. It was hard to cut with a knife. (Overcooked?) The marsala sauce was thin and without much flavor. The steamed broccoli and carrots we're very good. 
Overall I was disappointed.

Don't come here. We tried to eat here tonight but received absolutely terrible service before we were even sat. The hostess was extremely rude and treated us an inconvenience. She also provided us with numerous eye rolls and blatant avoidance. We were early for our reservation and saddled up to the bar ($8 for a vodka soda!). However, there were empty tables throughout the restaurant. At our reservation time, they still wouldn't seat us because another party was 25 minutes late for their reservation. How this correlates with our reservation is still a mystery to me. Our party of 9 ended up leaving and going to a locally owned restaurant right down the road. Avoid this place!

My boyfriend and I ate here for the first time last night and loved it. So many great menu items, it was hard to choose from. I had the seafood dish that was fresh and delicious. Service was prompt and attentive and the atmosphere was adorable! When we first arived there was a two person band setting the mood for the evening. I would definitely come again and recommend to friends.

First time was three years ago on our first date. Tonight was our last visit to La Scala. We had the two specials. Sea bass and osso buco. Both were slimy and salty. Worst osso buco in 40 years. It's a shame this place has gone so down hill.

Sweet potato ravioli !!!!! absolutely wonderful.
Also tried the spaghetti carbonara and they did not mind adding eggplant to it for me, and it was just delicious as well. 

Cute little place with an overall good food selection. They have an extensive wine list as well. 
only thing that bugged the shit out of me was they had that white construction paper covering the cloth table cover and it was just annoying. i mean really? you really cant afford to change the table cloths and wash them so you don't have to use that annoying tacky paper???yucky!

okay I'm done bitchin'

overall nice spot glad i finally checked it out.

It is now ten days later, and I want more of the pasta I ordered while I was at this restaurant. It was delicious and beyond my kitchen, some of the best pasta I've ever had. My friend ordered the eggplant orecchiette, which was pretty good. I got the squid in pasta and man, was it everything I wanted in pasta that night. The garlic wasn't overbearing and everything complemented the seafood so well. The seafood, besides the shrimp, were well prepared. And even though the shrimp was overcooked a little it was still delicious. 
I wish for the price you could have gotten a small house salad or something, but the pasta dishes weren't too unreasonable. And for how much pasta I got, I feel it was worth the 19 dollars I spent. I took half home and ate it two more meals. They have free bread too which is perfect. Soft and warm on the insides and crusty on the outside. 
My one real complaint is that even though it wasn't very busy, service took a while to get drinks on the table and such. Plus, we had three different people coming to our table so if I asked one person for something, or server would come back and not know we were waiting. 
All in all, I'd like to go this place again the next time I'm in Arizona.

We had dinner here. The salads were excellent. I had some type of squash ravioli with Gorgonzola cheese. The Gorgonzola cream sauce was pretty heavy.  Next time I order that, I would ask for it on the side, so I could control the amount of sauce on my pasta. 

The service was a little slow but we still enjoyed ourselves.

My husband out of the squid ink pasta with tomato and garlic sauce. He absolutely loved it!  

I would definitely come back here again. We got there early so it wasn't as crowded and as we were leaving about 7 o'clock it was getting pretty full.

The service is one of the worst I've encountered.
The server ignores us and serves other people who came in later than us.
She dropped the menu on the table and walked away after I asked for the lunch specials. 
She served bread to the new table and didn't come to our table at all for about 15 mins. 
The pizza with artichokes, sausage and prosciutto was so-so. Not impressed.
Will not go back again.

Honestly if I could give no stars I would. I can't comment on the food, but the service is to be lacking. We had a reservation for 8, we showed up early and they couldn't seat us. I get that, but there were 2 large open tables. They claimed they had other reservations, and it turns out the other reservations were late (30 min late). I was sitting at the bar the whole time and heard them talking crap about us and rolling their eyes. Also who has a plaque for a 'B' rating!? They do. Hope you have better luck than us.

Haven't been in a few years, but used to go to conventions at the hotel across the street pretty regularly, and the boccocini are something I crave to this day.  Everything we had there was just excellent, and the staff did quite well at accommodating big groups.

Definitely will come back to try more dishes or have the same ones again.  We have been coming to downtown Chandler for some time now but we somehow missed this gem.  The food is absolutely delicious and the ambiance is perfect.  Have gone with a group of people multiple times and it was a mixed order of veg and non veg dishes.  Everyone raved about their dish... so it seems like you can't go wrong with your pick.

Downside is that the wait time is long but the food is delicious, which is why I'll be going back.  We usually grab some vino and wait by the bar for our table.

A great date place. Atmosphere is nice and relaxed. The waiter we had was very helpful and knowledgeable. I had the lasagna which was very good but exactly what you would expect for lasagna. My girlffriend got the sweet potato ravoli which was amazing. We also got the tiramisu which was great. The only complaint I would have is that the bread wasn't very good. It just wasn't crispy or flavorful. Overall, La Stalla is excellent.
Went for lunch. Fries were good. Waiter was rude. The others around the table liked what they had: spaghetti with meat balls, margarita pizza, and sub.

Perfecto! I had the chocolate soufflé and the cappuccino. They were both great and the service was awesome. The only thing that was off putting was the bathroom. I felt like I was in the bathroom of a Burger King. I would come back.

Ok...so I am one sided about this place! My husband and I consider ourselves "regulars". If you are looking for spaghetti and meatballs, this is not that type of Italian food! This restaurant is truely authentic Italian food....the "soul food" of Italy. I just love the boar, yes I said boar meat sauce over Pappardelle! Don't knock it 'til ya tried it!!

Not sure what Italian food the other negative reviews have eaten but this food is the real deal! Lasagna was primo and the gnocchi was out of this world! Cami is the best too. Good hearts and great food. Can't go wrong here! Go here! Try it! You won't be disappointed.

What a great Happy Hour at La Stalla!  My wife and I go quite a bit for an early dinner and can walk out for less than $20. 

Happy Hour is every evening from 4 - 6 an we usually get a beer or two a piece (at only $2) and great authentic Italian pizza (at only $5 a pie).  

When we've ate a full dinner - it's always been great as well. The desserts are fantastic ... Check out La Stalla!

The ambiance was surprising. We are staying across the street and while checking in we notice this adorable place.  The service is impeccable, the food impeccable and extremely happy we spent our time here relaxing. Also their wine list has a good variety.

Great Happy Hour! Good beer selection, half price gourmet pizza and a comfortable atmosphere! Happy hour is 4 to 6 except on Tuesdays when they are closed. Great homemade lemonchello! Service is OK, this is why they didn't get 5 stars. People are friendly, but not very speedy. They have my favorite local beer on tap! Half price Pie and good beer - you cant really go wrong! Check out La Stalla~

Excellent Italian food; some of the very best pizza anywhere. Attentive service and reasonable prices. Do yourself a favor, gents--don't show up here in your shorts and polo shirts. Put on something nice and take your date out to a terrific lunch or dinner at this cozy restaurant.

The food is outstanding. So delicious. But the service is AWFUL. Every time we come we wait forever for a waiter to even acknowledge us. There last Thursday and waited 20 minutes with no waiter. We left and went to DC steakhouse. HIRE MORE STAFF

Decor and atmosphere are warm & inviting.  Service and food were very good.  Staff was extremely courteous

Location is great, in a plaza setting.

Stopped in last week and was in the mood for a calzone. Ordered mine to go and was all excited, but ended up being disappointed. The cheese inside was good, but there were no spices to be found. The cheese inside was layered in an odd way as such you didn't get the ricotta and mozzarella at the same time. Sure won't be getting this again, but might give a pie a go and see if that's any better. Meh...

I really wanted to like this place, as it just would be so nice to find good Italian food in the Phoenix area, and it's close to home. But I was overall very disappointed in the food. The only thing I liked, honestly, was the bread and the wine. 

We had the prosciutto fresh mozzarella dish and it was greasy, bland, salty and just bad. Our main dishes were the spaghetti carbonara, and it was such an Americanized "past with alfredo sauce" version of it. Very cheesey and creamy and way overpowering smoked pancetta. It was truly awful.  And at $16 or $18 a plate, hardly worth it and far from what traditional pasta carbonara should be. I'm not sure why restaurants use a cheesy alfredo sauce for carbonara, when it should be egg used for the consistency, not gobs of cheesy sauce. Bleh!

The atmosphere, wine and bread were good, but I can get that at home. Was sorely disappointed and felt the regret of spending $80 on a totally mediocre to bad experience with the food.

I have yet to find good Italian food in the Phoenix area. The closest thing is the new Italian Restaurant by Chris Bianco. Meatballs to die for!

I would have given 5 stars but the night we  went here dinner service was very slow.  Our table hardly noticed because we were enjoying apps, drinks and conversation. The party of 8 next to us looked like they wanted murder us because our dinner came out before theirs!!! We were entertained by their anger.
Other than that, food was great! Lemon drop martinis...yum.

Ordered the chicken parm and a veal dish.

Food was good but not great.  The chicken parm came out warm versus hot.  No real comments on the veal dish.

The veggies that came with both were pretty decent.

Not sure this place will make it into my rotation, but I haven't ruled out going back.

After reading what other yelpers were saying about this place, I am glad that it wasn't just me. Their service is absolutely horrible. I honestly don't know how they receive a 4 stars overall rating. 

Since I am a big supporter of the local restaurants, we figure we would give this place a try. Hostess was friendly to us, but our server was horrible. She is a older short blonde hair lady & another waitress was following her all night (possibly a trainee). When she came over twice to take our order for drinks and entrees, she made me repeat myself multiple times and gave me a puzzle look as though she didn't understand the word that was coming out of my mouth. I honestly felt discriminated. I began speaking much louder and I think she eventually got the point. We asked for more bread (only once) and she gave us an attitude & appeared to be annoyed. The whole experience made us feel horrible. 

For entree, we ordered a lasagna and a spaghetti. They were both average. We probably would have come here to try something else again if it wasn't for the attitude we received. 

If you want great service, don't come here. I personality will not ever come here again.

My aunt and I love this place!  The decor is great and the service did not let us down!  Both of our meals were wonderful and we left craving more.  We will definitely return here once I find time to visit AZ!

Random side note: during our dinner here, we sat in the back of the restaurant and I was bit about 20 or so times on my ankle by a spider or some type of bug.  The bites stuck around for months!  I called and asked if this happened to anyone else and the hostess said 'no'.  Just be careful if you're wearing open toed shoes!
